head.title: Niangua R-V School District - Announcements & Upcoming Events

font.font: After receiving recent information from local, state, and federal authorities, Niangua R-5 Schools will be extending the current school closure through the remainder of the school year. All extra and co-curricular activities will continue to be cancelled during the closure.

br.font:
Elementary Teachers can begin bagging individual student items for parent pickup or delivery. We will be delivering with food and AMI packets on Mondays if they are unable to pickup. Mrs. Allen will be taking pictures of student jackets/coats hanging in the hallway for parents to claim digitally. Remaining student items will be washed and collected in lost and found.
Middle School/High School students will be allowed to enter the buildings following a schedule. This will be completed by family. Students will be the only people allowed to retrieve items from lockers. Students will leave all books in lockers for administrators to retrieve and place on tables in the Old Gym. If MS/HS teachers have personal items belonging to students, they need to be removed.
ALL COLLECTED WORK WILL NEED TO BE TURNED IN BY 8 P.M. ON MONDAY, MAY 11, 2020. The final AMI packet will be distributed on Monday, May 4, 2020.

font.font:
Mrs. Donaldson will be accepting instruments from students. If students are not using the instruments, they can be brought up when they clean their locker or on Mondays during food pickup. If students are using the instruments, they need to be returned before
Friday, May 15, 2020.

br.font: Graduation will still take place on Friday, May 8, 2020. Baccalaureate has been cancelled. Prom has been postponed with a date to be announced.
If you have any questions, please direct them to the district through my email at

div.font: We will be providing meal services for all students 18 and under beginning March 23 free of charge through the USDA Emergency Meal plan. You MUST sign up in order to receive a meal. You can pick it up in the car line or it will be delivered to your bus stop between 9-11 each day. Adult meals are available for $2.30 breakfast; $3.05 lunch and are PICK UP ONLY. Drivers will not have cash. Once you are signed up, meals will continue. You DO NOT need to sign up everyday.

br.font: In the students name section, list ALL students you would like a meal for. This number should match the number of meals requested. If I list two students: Syd and Dalton, then the number of meals should be 2. Each student will get lunch and breakfast-which will only count as 1 meal.
If you have questions or there is a change in your situation, please call Meredith at 417-473-6101 ext. 124.

span.font: Graduation will still be held on May 8th at 7:00. This will be a small, outdoor ceremony for the graduates and immediate family. Following the ceremony we ask that all other family and friends line the streets of Niangua for a Class of 2020 parade.

u.font: PK Save My Spot (Click here to go to form)

strong.span: Early learning reservation for PK (preschool) students not currently enrolled. New students only! Students must be 3 on or before July 31, 2020 and should be potty trained. By completing this form, you will be reserving your child's spot in pre-school. We will have the contact information we need to get in touch with you in August to set up a screening time. Classroom placements will not be made until after screenings occur.

strong.font:
